Oh if it only had that slightly dry roastiness that I crave so much in the finish. Oh well, still an exemplary beer.

Bottle - good size foamy head, nice dark copper color, sweet malty aroma and flavor, mild honey notes, mild nuttiness, pretty good Oktoberfest beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma caramel, bread, citrus, 
Appearance golden, clear, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, 
Palate light body, medium body, average carbonation, 
Overall not my style of beer but that being said I would suggest this beer to a friend

Sweaty honey color, not a lot of head at all. Looks more like the German version of a lager than the American version. 

Aroma has some sweet candi sugars and cereal grains. A little corn syrup, with a hop-nose of pollen and hay. Its mostly sweet, with just a touch of Euro-bitterness.

The flavor is corn syrup and. The hop is there, but it is very mild and is more like pollen and hay. Pretty consistent between aroma and taste. Its a very mild, pleasant flavor. Buttery/biscuity notes. That flowery hop comes out after a few minutes.

Slick and buttery consistency. Its a very pleasant beer, that gets better as you let it aerate and spread out a bit. Really changes as you get further down into the glass.

Looks like Hazy light caramel.
Smells like caramel and bread.
Slightly sweet, medium- light bitter, slightly sour. Tastes like caramel and bread.

Best Oktoberfest Ive had.
I liked it quite a bit. Had a really smooth and nice flavor. Very easy drinking. Malty.
Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours dark orange with beige head. Malty, caramel and spicy. Medium bodied. Quite drinkable.

From a German beer pub a while ago, not many notes, sorry.
Bottled. Aroma: Caramel, hops, hay, malt. Appearance: I think I am reading "darker color with amber/some gold." Taste: Hops and malt but there is good balance with some underlying honey. Palate: Easy to drink but quite flavorful. Nice stuff.
Nice colour, higher carbonization. The taste is mild, very drinkable but also nit distinctive and not very special. Overall, not bad but also far from best.
Aroma is light, grains and fruit. Taste is same with nice malt backbone. Very light and refreshing. Good feel to it. Overall very good octoberfest beer.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 Hazy copper color, big sized creamy off-white head, disappeared quickly. Aroma of caramel malt and spices. Malty sweet. Easy to drink. OK. (Pivoljub 0,5l bottle)
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Hay notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Bottle. Pours a mostly clear light amber color with a moderate off-white head on there. Nose is light with some grains to it and just a bit of breadiness coming through. Taste is slightly sweet, with a fair amount of bread, toast, and grains to it. Decent.
Bottle. Cloudy orange-golden pour with a white head. Surprisingly fruity, lots of tropical fruit, some sultana raisins. Very malty, but lots going on.

Golden tan color, thin head. Smell is fresh, fruity, a little nutty, oily, clean fruit and hops. Taste is spicy, pumpkin, a little sweet, crisp, refreshing, savory in a vegetabley way. Long sparkling finish. Excellent for any occasion or any reason.

Poured from bottle. Classic octoberfest beer with a strong malt opening and a dry finish. Definitely one to pick up when the seasons change. 

--you've been Dubbed.

Pours amber with little head. Smell is slightly yeasty, some sweet notes are present. Taste is quite pleasant. One of more enjoyable beers in my opinion. Light, almost no body, with a sweet afterntaste that is not long lasting. A very good kirtabier!
caramel, bread, hay, toast, grass, citrus, herbs, dough, banana, raisin, vanilla, amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

This brew is a thing of beauty. Bubbly goodness travelling up the glass to form a perfect a head. Smells great! Smooth. Great after taste. Lots of flavour. Lots going on. Lingers. Warms. Paul Ay(z)inger would enjoy this one. I need to find this beer in town and load up. Don't want this party to end. My taste buds will be boogeyin' long after this beer is done. Yowzer wowzer. Long live Ayinger Oktoberfest Marzen!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of sticky malt. Sweetish creamy finish.

Bottle purchased at Four Firkins and consumed with commonshawn. Golden/copper color with minimal head. Sweet aromatics with bubblegum and candy-like notes. Expectations of malt and bread are met with the initial impact on the tongue. Some nutty, caramel characteristics but in general its a pretty straightforward Oktoberfest. Aftertaste is malty and sweet. Its probably in the upper echelon of Oktoberfest/marzen options.

Medium bottle from four firkins with commonmac. Light copper with white head. Sweet grain malt, very german nose. Strong aroma. Slightly metallic sweet malt grain. Consistent taste throughout. Typical of style, was expecting more.

Pours a clear coppery color, topped with a decent beige colored head. Mild malty aroma with some notes of caramel in the background. Taste is sweet, caramel notes, finishing with slightly roasty feel and medium bitterness. Nice one.

One of my favorites, very smooth and drinkable. Malty with slight sweetness, in my opinion the perfect example of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
An nice Summer beer. Pours a bright golden with a white head. Smells of peaches and pears. Taste is smooth with more peach, wheat and a honey finish. Had in the bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Pours a hazy copper with little to no retention. Aroma of biscuit and yeast (in a good way). Taste of toast and caramel. Smooth, almost buttery palate... mouth feel is remarkable. The finest Ive had yet of this style. Off to get another!
** Old rating, 0,5l crown-top-bottle, 2006.  Süffig-dunkles und leicht süßliches Festbier. Würzig, kaum herb, süßlich-süffig.
Braun rot Kupfer, malzig alkoholisch in der Nase, frisch malzig im Antrunk, sehr süffig, gut trinkbar

Cloudy red color, average sized beige head that quickly disappeared. Medium body, average carbonation. Aroma of malt, yeast, dark fruits. Taste is also malty with caramel and strawberries. Medium sweet taste, very little bitterness. Nice enough.

Appearance is clean an light golden with a thick white foam cap. Aroma is toast and bread crust, with a hint of raisin. Taste is rich bread and caramel, with some raisin and light toast. Mouthfeel is medium with a slight creaminess and moderate carbonation. Finishes with a nice bitterness to balance the rich caramel malt that lingers.
Great drinkability. I would have no problem. Drinking this by the stein. Pours dark amber with good head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Good malt. Hint of hops. Great barley aroma. Bottle.
500 ml bottle. Strong floral and fruity nose. Very light caramel and malt body. Banana in taste. This is far superior to any American marzen on the market. But most people know that already.

An exceptional Octoberfest beer, the best Ive ever had. 500ml bottle from BevMo. Subtle yet distinctive flavor where the malt and hops are nicely balanced. A clean finish and low bitterness. Definitely will buy again.

Draught at Taphouse. Low fluffy white quickly disappearing head. Hazy amber body. Sweet fruity alcohol dominated malt caramel aroma and flavor with hints of almonds and a suitable amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

500 ml from greens. From the revised list of most ratings and available in ga. Nice roastiness and baked bread and caramel and candi sugar. Little nutty. Little grassy on the finish. Great beer for the style and time of year.

Excellent. Just the perfect representation of the style as far as i can tell. Amber red, decent head reducing quickly to a film. Appetizing aroma of lightly toasted malt. Fully rounded and lightly malty, mouth filling and very quaffable, slightly spritzy carbonation. Slighty fruity finish.
"well balanced between the different malts, and a very light hop profile, only descernable in the finish. an ok style, this one stands out a little. definitely recommended if you like the style."

Bottle: Poured a golden/amber color lager with a huge white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of clean cereal notes with light grainy notes. Taste is dominated by clean cereal notes with a touch of sweetness and some light grainy notes also noticeable. Body is above average for style with good carbonation. Simple and easy to drink with good balance overall.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 They make great beer in the town of Aying. Unfortunately, this is not one of them. Pours a clear amber with good foam retention. The aroma is strongly of DMS.  Way too much sulfur in both the nose and the flavor.  Lots of cooked corn and vegetables in the profile.  There are much better examples of this style being brewed in the US.  I am surprised that their quality control has let this slide and have the feeling that the batches which did not quite turn out as desired were exported to places where the beer drinkers are more "understanding".

Draught at Craft Beer Market, VancouverHazy light amber color with compact head. Mild aroma of cereals and malt. Good body strength, with the expected mellow maltiness, and accents of honey, bread and hay; lowish bitterness.Simple but clean, and pleasant to drink.

Probably the best Oktoberfest in the world. Light enough to have a few and such a classic smooth taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really good, the flavor and mouthfeel and finish really are harmonious, delicious. Sweet but not overly so at all, very balanced and delicious beer.

Pours a fairly clear copper with a large initial off white head that slowly settles into a nice thin but dense top and leaves great lace. Aroma is rich maltiness, melanoidins, toast. Flavour is rich maltiness/sweetness, melanoidins, bread crusts, mild noble hop like bitterness, fairly clean and a moderately dry finish. Great example of the style!
On draft. Amber color with one finger head. Caramel and grain aroma. Smooth caramel taste. It just goes down so easy.

Tap at St Urhos Pub, Helsinki. Clear mid-copper shade. Very short head. Aroma is caramel, berries, like many amber coloured beers. Taste has deep caramel tones and a nettle hop sting. The most impressive thing is the superbly robust body. Nothing particularly complex, but it seems to nail this style.

Pours a clear, coppery amber with a rich and creamy off white head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, pine, wheat, and faint citrus. Taste is sweet caramel, molasses, mild floral notes and finished with a lingering hint of smoke. Full body, foamy and bubbly carbonation. A very nice, easy to drink beer that still manages to retain a lot of depth and character. Fabulous for a style Im not usually that crazy for.

Pours a crystal clear copper amber color with white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma has lots of malts and caramel nutty flavor, a bit of sugary sweetness, slight spiciness. Flavor has lots of sweet malts with some spicy hops, a bit floral. Lighter to medium bodied, carbonation on the higher end. Good example of the style. Better than most American versions of the style I have had.
Tap. Pours a transparent golden with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma and taste of bread malts, some hops, hints of caramel.

To celebrate a style I really dont care for I went and got the #1. Pours slightly hazed copper with big super splashy sticky lace. Smell is sweet caramel, bready, light floral, fruity. Taste is bright fruity caramel, but somewhat delicate. Slight mineral notes. Understandably the best of a style that I mostly forget. Soft palate with light carbonation and medium finish.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 Draught at Ayingers Speis & Trank, Munich and from bottle at different occasions as "Kirtabier". Dark copper, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, beige head, that dissipates quickly. Aroma of caramel, bread, grains, grass, roast, honey, some fruity hops, slight spices. Taste is about the same. Mouthfeel is light, slick, with a lively carbonation and it finishes grainy and sweet malty, slightly roasty. Very good! A pretty above average Märzen, more in the traditional style, with full, caramelic malts. Very well balanced and with the distinct smoothness many Ayinger beers are offering, while being very fresh.
Ambré foncer avec un tête moyen beige. Larôme du malt un peu sucré et un petit peu dhoublon floral. Le goût est du malt sucré avec un peu du sucré et une finale très peu amer.

From bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow with a small white head and lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is light fruits and caramel and malty yeast. Taste is the same, nicely sweet, almost no hops. Medium mouthfeel, gentle carbonation. Delicious.

Radiant orange body with a small white cap. Aromas of lager yeast, subtle spice, fruity malt. Smells true to style. Clean and easy drinking. A good Oktoberfest bier is a thing of beauty. Its that time of year. A solid German brew.
Pours clear amber, beautiful two finger head that lasts. Aroma is fruit (plum?) and malt sweetness. Taste is great example of marzen lager. Love it.
Pours a clear orange-gold with a white head. Aromas of bread and honey. Flavors of caramel and honey.

Purchased from Learys, the Amesbury location, earlier today. $3.75 for the 500 mL bottle. To long-stemmed white wine glass it pours a clear carrot orange with which a bubbly, off-white head two fingers in length stood. Aromas of Munich malt, cherry tomatoes, noble hops, spent grain, sweat, and celery leaves. Tastes the same with the addition of minerals, young oak, German yeast, and papaya-flavored seltzer water. Had experienced a metallic aftertaste by swallow. Im not in love with the style, but I definitely could drink this again.

Drank this last night, with cheese crackers , and olives. Wonderful color, beautiful amber color. Head is nice, but dissipates quickly. I am NOT a particular fan of lager beer, outside of dopplebock or eiebock but the taste was very nice. And clean what I would expect from a German Beer. Overall, I gave this beer a 15. I would certainly drink this again, this is not a beer I would particularly cellar, or keep on hand.

500 mL bottle poured into a shaker. Aromas of butterscotch and buttered toast are strongest initially, but these give way to citrus notes of orange and tangerine along with some floral notes and peach cobbler as well as some vanilla and green grapes late. It pours a clear yellow amber with an oily appearance. Its topped by a soft, but rocky looking white head which eventually reduces down to a medium foamy ring with a soft, full, fuzzy layer on the surface. A moderate, puffy lace is left on the glass. The taste is mostly a medium, smooth, malty sweet with a light, mellow, spicy bitter. The slick, medium-light bodied beer is smooth with a light, fizzy carbonation. Theres notes of caramel and butterscotch on the palate and it finishes with a citrus and spice combination. The aftertaste is light, spicy, and clean, and doesnt linger long.

Appearance: this beer is a very clear average golden color with hints of amber, pours with a large beige head that has above average retention and density 
Aroma: very sweet, strong caramel, perhaps some flowers, brown sugar, 
Taste: sweet caramel, hints of grain throughout, floral hints too 
Palate: very smooth drinking, soft carbonation, heavier mouthfeel, slight sweet aftertaste 
Overall: this is pretty dang good marten, very strong caramel throughout, pretty sweet too but goes down easy, perfect for a fall festival 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear faint orange pour. Aroma of apples, spices and sweet bread. Sweet malt and cracker taste. Bubbly and effervescent. Really nice.

This is the best Oktoberfest beer I have had. You have to let this one warm up a bit, do not drink this too cold. The flavors will be hidden, let it warm and the flavors will open. The nose is of natural cereal and bread. The palate is similar with soft malt. When compared to all the others, it is clear that this is special. A world class Oktoberfest. Prost!
If you have traveled Europe and the U.S. sampling the best marzen beers available.... you know the German quality is easily superior and this beer being one of the best overall.

Transfer from BA review on 9-12-13-

 Poured from 500 ml bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a hazy amber color with a huge billowy amber tinted head. The head has great retention fading slowly over time to leave some streaky lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of some roasted malt and a bit of a biscuit aroma. Some smells of a slightly sour nature as well as some caramel, citrus and a bit of spice round out the aroma nicely.

 Taste  The tastes begins with a smooth sweeter caramel and lightly toasted malt flavor. As the flavor moves forward a biscuit and cracker taste as well as some graininess comes to the tongue. The sweetness grows bit stronger to the end, as some lighter flavors of dark fruits and a bit of citrus comes to the tongue. While it sweetens and grows a bit more malty, a light herbal flavor as well as a bit of spice join the flavors at the end, to leave a rather balanced malty and sweet flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the creamier side with a carbonation level that is just below average to average. The creamy body is rather nice for the mix of sweeter and malty taste with just enough carbonation to keep it on the easy drinking side.

 Overall  A quite nice and tasty Oktoberfest with a great blend of sweet, malty, roast, and some spice. A job well done.

Huge head with sweet caramel notes on the nose. Medium mouth. Sweet taste full of caramel and some faint bitterness. Almost floral. Nice and light, very easy drinking. Easily one of the best in this style.

Poured from bottle into tall lager glass. Clear orangey-gold color with bright white bubbly head. Smells of yeasty bread and very very faint hops. Taste is more bread. Medium thin body, nice crisp feel. Overall, not too much to it, pretty typical lager. Very German (obviously, its from Bavaria), very good example of the style. Also, very refreshing. Prost!
Light on the overall aroma, appearance is perfect, first taste is caramel maybe hints of butterscotch and vanilla, great overall body and flavor, easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours a copper color with white head. Toasty, malty, slight caramel aromas. Maltier oktoberfest flavors of bread, malts and slight earthiness. Second best of four german oktoberfest beers blind tasted.
Bottle poured into a big ol stein. The best Oktoberfest beer Ive had since New Glarus Staghorn
Bready, floral, licorice, butter, paper, orange marmalade. Solid but seems a bit oxidized.

Bottle.

A: Solid copper penny color. Fluffy off-white head. Bubbles racing through the body.

N: Toffee and biscuit. Sweet grape. Husk. Quick breads. Some melon. Touch of clove. 

T: Sweet and malty. Not much bitterness at all 

M: Light body. Good carbonation. 

O: Extremely tasty. Flavorful ad easy drinking. Recommended.

Clear light amber pour with a hint of garnet. Massive head with excellent lacing and retention. The nose is sweet biscuit malt with a little caramel over a faint, almost citric, spiciness. Nice light medium body with a slick smooth texture that approaches creamy. Slightly above normal carbonation with a good bit of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is quite nice, a bit complex, and very well balanced. The sweet malt flavors are there, but not to the extent that they are overpowering. It begins with sweet biscuit, flows to a caramel note and then the effervescence cleans the palate and allows the complexity to escape. The middle presents a multitude of subtle flavors - citric, dark fruit, light bitterness and spicy hops. The smooth finish leaves you with a blend of the aforementioned flavors.

Dark golden/copper color, big white head. Aroma of malt and bread with hints of caramel and hop. Malty sweet taste with bready and caramel notes, balanced by light hoppy bitterness. I liked this beer.
Slightly oversweet fest beer with a sturdy maltiness and little in the way of hops. Smooth drinking but a little short on flavor.

Pours a dark gold/light copper color with a decent white head. Many streams of tiny bubbles hint at a high degree of carbonation. Aroma is malt forward with toasty and bready notes. Some spicy hop notes evident behind that. Taste is nicely malt up front: bread, toast, biscuit with a hint of caramel. Very dry throughout. Finishes up with some spicy hops and a touch of lingering bitterness. Alcohol heat lingers. 

Overall a very nice octoberfest: malt forward but balanced. Exceptionally drinkable!

Pours clear golden from a 500ml bottle with a thick white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is sweet on the nose, malty. Taste is yeast, malt, hops, and a tad of caramel sweetness. Has strong carbonation on the tongue with a nice clean finish. Good Oktoberfest beer.

500 ml bottle from Trader Joe's. Deep golden color and good, active white head. Aroma is pretty strong compared to others in the style. Malty and bready, sweet nose. The taste matches the smell for most part. High level of carbonation. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle - pours nice amber/copper color . Sweet , mild citrus twinge with some floral components . Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance- big foamy ivory white head that lasted a long time and left pretty decent lacing. Clear, amber, honey gold. Most appealing. 

Smell- clean, malty, bready, (slightly) spicy.

Taste- toasted malts, biscuity, caramel. Very, very pleasant. 

Mouthfeel- light, smooth. Excellent balance.

Overall- very nice. A solid brew. Never used to be a big fan of Marzen/Oktoberfest, but starting to enjoy more and more. Would have again (and again) and definitely recommend.

Cheers!

Bottle from Nathaniels. Pretty amber-orange, clear, fine thick head. Nutty, malty nose, light caramel, earthy hops, light peach and orange. Sweet fruity, nutty, malty, some raisins. A bit old, perhaps. Tasty, rich, fruity, and malty. Good, but did not move me as I was hoping it would. I really need to try this fresh in Germany on tap.
Bottle - By far the best Marzen/Octoberfest I have had. Malt forward and bready. Hops take a backseat as usual but even more so in this beer. Clean semi-dry finish. Awesome everyday Fall beer.

Very very smooth. Extremely easy drinking. Before I knew it bottle was gone. Very malty and sweet, good strait forward marzen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour. Pours a nice copper color with a lasting, patchy head. Bready flavor and aroma. Really nice, easy drinking beer here. Good stuff.
Pours a nice copper with an effervescent white head. Nice gently malty bready nose and taste. You can tell this beer was aged appropriately drinking real nice and smooth, as it should.

Pint bottle into snifter glass, clear copper color with fluffy off-white head. Aroma of warm bread, caramel and faint apple/fruity note. Taste adds notes of grain, toast, honey, dark fruit and balanced earthy hops. Medium-light body, low-moderate carbonation, soft, creamy with clean caramel finish. Very drinkable excellent Oktoberfest.

500 ml bottle, the beer pours a mostly clear dark gold/amber color with about an inch frothy off-white head that sticks around a while. Theres also a lot of lacing. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like caramel and bready malt, honey, and light earthy hops. Taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but with the addition of a bit of apple and dark fruit. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its smooth and easy to drink with moderate carbonation. I thought this was a good Oktoberfest brew, Id buy this again in the future. $3.49 a bottle.

I really enjoyed this beer. It is an excellent style that reminds me of fall and this is one of my favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Dark Bready Malts, Mild Caramel

Appearance: Deep Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Dark Bready Malts, Mild Caramel, Mildly Floral

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

500 ml bottle. Pours light brown sugar color with a small tan head. Smells of sweet caramel. Tastes like a caramel apple with a little crisp hop flavor. The perfect fall beer thats refreshing and tasty while still remaining a beer. One of my all time favorites.

Pours with a medium foam---1/2 inch---disappears quickly. Nice deep gold color and slight off-white head. Faint sweet clover-like aroma ("floral"?)and smells of yeast/bread with slight hop aroma. Taste is like a American lager but perhaps a bit more hop flavor and much more crisp/tart on the back palate---slightly acidic. Overall, pleasant if somewhat boring "old world" style; compared to hop-bombs and weird formulations so popular in many craft brews today.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a good head and some lacing. Aroma of malt, bit of fruit and caramel sweetness. Taste of malt, caramel sweetness with trace of fruit and grain. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Moderate body, smooth, easy feel to it. Enjoyable beer, one of the better beers for the style.

Pint nine bottle shared. Pours a deep golden amber with white head and spider web lacing. Aroma is mildly sweet malts with some floral overtones. The flavor is crisp and clean exactly what an octoberfest beer should taste like. Mild sweetness in the malts. Floral hops and finishes crisp and clean. Give me liters of this one.

Pours a clear, copper-golden color with a large light tan head. Some carbonation bubbles migrate from the bottom. Sorghum and Christmas pull candy on the nose. Puffy mouthfeel with a slight burn on the rear of the palate. The bitterness profile cuts the sweetness expected from the aroma. It imparts a fruitiness where the sweet pull candy and sorghum wouldve otherwise dominated.

It has a rich deep golden color with very good clarity and some nice carbonation flowing up to the head. The head has a creamy off white color and rises up tall in the glass before slowly settling down to a nice foamy cap. In the nose there are some sweet bready and light toasted notes with light grain and some floral/spicy hops. The flavor has a very enjoyable malty character. There is mild sweetness, bready and light toasted grain notes, pie crust and very light caramel notes. This is balanced by some mild bitterness and notes of spicy/floral hops. The hops turn more leafy and mineral like in the finish which is crisp and refreshing. Its body has a solid medium to full feel with well balanced carbonation.
A great beer for an excellent price! Once in awhile it pays to go to the source of excellent beer!

500 ml bottle at home from notes 2011. Pours a slightly hazy golden amber color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor were malt forward with doughy bread, caramel, some fruitiness, mild floral character with a dry lightly toasted finish. Solid Oktoberfest.

For the style, this is about as smooth and flavorful as this beer can get. Ayingers brew is rich, malty, and sweet. However, theres a bit of hoppy spice to give this brew a crisp, clean finishing note. As drinkable as it is beautiful, Oktober Fest-Marzen is a fantastic option for bratwurst and rich meats.

Bottle.

A- Caramel, malty.

A- Copper color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Malty, spices, subtle burnt caramel.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- One of the best Oktoberfests out there that I have had. Lots of spice and heavy malts.
Pours a nice clear copper color with off-white head. Caramel malt, floral notes, and some toffee notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a good amount of malt.
500 ml bottle. A dark gold beer with a big, thick creamy head. Malty aroma with hops and caramel. Flavor is slightly sweet with malt, caramel and a little hoppy dry finish. Not bad.
Oh, is this splendid. Lets start with the scent. Beautiful burnt malts. It follows through in flavor. This is a malt-heavy beer, and it is stunning. Just stunning.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was a cloudy golden copper colored body with a two finger white foamy head that gently dies leaving a lacing that coats the sides of the glass.
The smell had some toasted breadiness and slightly earthy graininess.
The taste was sweet and toasty and earthy, slightly earthy malty aftertaste and a dry mild malty finish.
On the palate, it sat about a medium, and was semi-sessionable. Carbonation is good for the style and for me (somewhat smooth yet satisfying).
Overall, this was a wonderful Oktoberfest style beer, but of course it is, its comin from where it was originally developed - my motherland.
Tap. Pours clear golden amber color with a large white head. Good lacing. Nose is sweet bread, and caramel. Taste is the same, just a little more hops. Very refreshing.
Malty, sweet, and well carbonated, with hints of warm bread and spices. A wonderfully drinkable session beer!
Bread, biscuits, dominate. This is a malty beer, not too much in the way of hop flavors. Not my favorite style, but for what it is its quite good. Excellent session beer for early fall.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 Love the bottle design and the fact that its a pint bottle, which I think more beers should be because I have pint glasses that I want to fill up! Pretty biscuity and fairly creamy palate, which is nice. The aroma is definitely better than the actual taste, but they compliment each other nicely. Ive drank this both out of the bottle and in a glass, and out of the bottle it is actually surprisingly bad!

.5L bottle. Pours a crystal clear dark gold/light amber with a huge billowy head. Aroma is fairly weak caramel malts. Taste is clean, sweet malts with a bit of a buttery, yeasty finish. Hops are extremely subdued and there is no real bitterness to this beer. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel. This makes an outstanding food beer and goes down easy. Not bad for the price.
A classic done right, I will enjoy this very good German beer a couple times a year from now on, makes Oktoberfest wannabes taste different

This golden reddish beer has a mild malty aroma. It is very well balanced not too hoppy with a smoky type flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
nice clean aroma,lite to medium body,very good for sipping or with a meal.meats,cheeses and barbecue meats.no bitterness,malt and hops blend nicely very refreshing.

Pours a crystal clear amber with a foamy white head. Aroma has a bit of band aid. It may be a bad bottle. Once behind it the aroma was honey sweet. The flavor is syrupy sweet up front with a touch of floral hops and a clean dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer brings me back to the time I was travelling on a train from Salzburg to Munich for the 2012 Oktoberfest. On the train I met a few locals and I decided to challenge the Germans to a beer drinking contest. By the time the first German hit the ground drunk I was about 6 liters deep and they were somewhere on their 4th and 5th. The weather was great that day
ambrata buona schiuma piuttosto persistenza buona nota maltata lieve nota caramellata amaro medio erbaceo

Poured from bottle into stein. Very nice bronze color with plenty of head. Malty aroma that did not hit you, very soft. Slightly thicker mouth feel. Taste is of malt and biscut. A little bitter on the aftertaste. I would have prefered this in early fall but very enjoyable and drinkable.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Pint bottle from Trader Joes. Very thick head but with minimal lacing. Lighter bodied than was initially expecting.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber with off white head. Taste slightly sweet, Carmel, malt. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear amber with a voluminous off-white foamy head and impressive carbonation. Nice caramel malty aroma with notes of hay and cereal. Slightly sweet malty flavor with enough hop presence to provide balance. Lively mouthfeel but still smooth and easy to drink. I can picture myself drinking a few ridiculously oversized steins of this.

poured from a 500 ml bottle to a pint glass. 
Smell: Has a strong sweat malty smell, but it doesnt seem to jump out at you.
Appearance: A gorgeous bronze tone with a well carbonated body, you can see the bubbles rising to the top of the perfectly formed carbonated head.
Taste: One word, Amazing.... sweat caramelized malts in the front of the beer and a slight hoppy note at the end, well balanced.
One of the better Octoberfest Ive had.

500 ml bottle into stein. Clear copper with thick head but no lacing in my ceramic stein. Aromas are heavily buttered biscuit, floral hops, and caramel. Flavors follow with early malt sweetness and late mild bitterness. Light to medium bodied, dry finish, moderate carbonation. My favorite Oktoberfest marzen.
Malt and floral slightly fruity nose. Clear honey gold with a thick lasting foamy off white head. Light and fresh. Very smooth with the slightest hoppy bitterness on the finish. Very well balanced.
Great looking beer! Crystal clear with a lasting foam. Nice malty aroma. Smooth easy drinking. Malty, biscuity awesomeness.

HQT Octoberfest. 500 ml. bottle. I guess Im just a wet blanket but I didnt think this was an enjoyable beer at all. A little on the thick side, with a bitter aftertaste. Didnt like the silage smell. I think it was a good light beer, that you could drink all day. Imsure it taste better on tap... and on Germany. Ill make sure to give it a second chance when Im there.

On tap at a beer garden. Nice amber glow with medium head. Taste is malt with hops layered in the background. Mild and smooth with good body. Just about perfect for an event where you are going to have several. It made many people smile. Well worth having.
Clear Copper Color, Huge Foamy Head, Decent Lacing. Slightly Sweet, Malt, Caramel, Light Bitter. Medium Body. Octoberfest classic and one of benchmarks. Good. Enjoyed. Easily Drinkable. Good.

Pours a beautiful amber honey with a white to slightly off white head of tightly packed bubbles. Its quite stunning. Wonderful aroma, like fresh bread: caramel, bread, roasty nuts, light resin, floral hops, some barnyard, some raisin, some soy sauce, some vanilla... quite complex. Taste is very well balanced. Lingering dry bitter finish is nice BUT I detected a strange soapy glue mouthfeel. Almost felt like I had licked to many envelopes... This might be from my serving temperature (much warmer than usual) OR I had some hamburger meat while reviewing. ANYWAY, great beer, highly recommend, would drink again, will buy again.

From a 500-ml bottle. Pours a golden color with a very thick head. Aromas are subtle--faint grass and malt. Flavors are caramel with subdued citrus notes and a very subtle malt bite. A decent, well-rounded beer.

Ayinger Oktober Fest-Märzen has a very thick, off-white head, a clear, bubbly, light copper appearance, and some decent lacing left behind. The aroma is of brown bread, bread crust, sweetness, and bread dough. Taste is of brown bread, bread dough, barley malt, sweetness, some sourness, and a nice, mellow hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and the beer finishes crisp, refreshing, and highly drinkable. This is a very enjoyable beer, and I score it most excellent. RJT

Une bouteille de 50 cl. Une robe dorée. Un anneau de mousse. Un nez malté. Du caramel. Du miel. De la pâte à pain. Une fleur. Une orange. Un goût malté. Des céréales riches. Du caramel au beurre. Une touche citronnée/florale. Un corps bien portant. Un pétillement actif. Une texture lourde et huileuse. Une finale intéressante. Des houblons à la remorque de céréales maltées. Bref, intéressante sans être renversante.

Orange clear beer, little darker than your average German Helles. Little white dense head which disappers quickly leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma is a bit like a bulk lager, maizey starchey sweet with some nice grassy hops as well. The taste is fortunately cleaner with maltiness, sweetness and crisp bitterness. The finish is medium long and bitter with a little alcohol coming through. Mouthfeel is smooth and thicker than medium. This is the kind of beer I would imagine drinking in Germany from a liter pint glass.

Delicious Oktoberfest. Copper color, foamy head. Strong malt flavor. All I need now is an Oom Pa band!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle to dimpled much. Pour is a deep hold, amber tint with a quickly dissipating tan head. Nose is what you would expect out of a marzen, nice and bready, roasted malt, slight caramel. Light-medium body, bitter but also sweet. Thicker feel, great carbonation. Should be the standard for the style.

Pours nearly clear, orange-gold with a thick, parchment coloured head.
Toasted caramel aroma.
Taste is sweet, caramel malt, bread heel.
Very malty...
Nice example of style.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Pours a beautiful golden orange with an off white head. The "picture perfect" beer when its sitting in the glass. Decent retention, not much in the way of lacing. Taste of toasty malts, bready, a little mild hoppiness, and a bit of a caramel sweetness as it settles on the palate. Great finish. This is hands down the best Oktoberfest/Marzen style beer out there. Just a perfect example of the style in my opinion. Love it.

This is a refreshing beer. Subtle hops and malt. The Color is a nice dark gold. 

---AJ's Approval

Tap at Bad Monkey Tavern. Copper gold pour with thick white head. Big bready malts with a nice touch of noble hops. Aroma is really clean with touches of warm bread and noble hops. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich dark gold. Two finger head, some lacing. Malty nose with a hint of hop. Taste is crisp and clean, with malty sweetness, followed by a bit of balancing bitterness, with a clean finish. Very very good example of a marzen.
Light aroma: Fruity, bread crust. Apple-ish fruity flavor; sweet, bread crust/biscuit malt; and herbal, spicy hops. A tiny bit of vegetable-like lager yeast in aftertaste.

0.5 L bottle. Caramel color, with a big, frothy, beige head. The aroma is butterscotch, light floral hops, biscuit dough, lemon zest, and nutmeg. The flavor is doughy sweetness, and a little hop bitterness. Light body, chalky feel, and a little chewy. This is a good, sticky, malty beer.

2013 but undated 500 ml bottle poured into a snifter. 

A: pours with a clear, medium amber body; plenty of visible carbonation; very durable near-white head. Fine lacing.

Aroma: clean, light smell of bready malts with only a faint touch of hops. 

T: Rich and bready malts dominante, as they should in this style. Very lightly sweet, although the finish is balanced out by the bitterness 

Feel: Medium but soft carbonation; medium-light body. About perfect for style. 

O: Outstanding, although this style lacks the complexity and intensity to achieve a very high rating. As good as any bottled märzen I can remember, and likely the best bottled example of an Oktoberfest youll find in the U.S.
Wow, this what an October Fest should be. Pours deep golden with thick white head. Good malt aroma with minimal hops, great balance, creamy mouth fedel, really good beer.
Bottle. Golden orange with a good creamy head. Aroma is mild, with a bit of hops coming through. Nice flavor. Creamy and sweet with a good bit of carbonation.

Pours a clear medium golden amber with a large frothy white head, mostly lasting with lace. This looks like the quintessential beer. Aroma is lightly sweet and toasty, bready, caramel balanced by floral/earthy hops. Flavor is much the same, with the hops taking a little more of a role. Medium body. Great balance. Soft, just right sweetness and light bitterness and just a little dry on the finish. Very tasty and endlessly drinkable. This is beer. Im not going to low rate this like most because its not an imperial or barley wine, etc. Its a top notch, well-made, great beer.

Malts, sweet, a little hops. Caramel, bready, toasty. Very balanced. Tastes similar. Remarkably balanced, very smooth. Nice ending, perfect amount of sweetness
Great way to start Oktoberfest!!!!!!

Appearance was clear deep gold with diminishing white creamy bubblely 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are simple pils sweet malts with hints of spicey hops, standard for style. Taste are different than nose with light sweet malt backbone, then the balance of the spicey,herbal noble hops. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 wih medium body, then the balance smooth average length easy drinking finish. One of he best marzans for a reason, try it.

Bottle. Pours an orange brown color with a small white head. Nose is strong malt and caramel. Taste is grainy and woody. Finish is malty as well and moderately long. At heart an  ale  lover, so will rate it as such. Quaff Score 6 / 10

Pours an amber orange with a beige head and aroma of malty aroma of caramel and bread. Taste is of sweet malt, caramel, bread notes, and grains with a crisp, caramel, malt finish. Drinkable, but not my favorite style
Draft at Alla Spina with Pat and Sean Tommy. Pours a clean amber with medium white head and soapy lace. Nose of bread, caramel, roast. Medium body. A little hop bitterness.

500 ml bottle. Pours a golden orange, perfect Oktoberfest color with a moderate off-white head. Aroma is Munich malts and German hops. Taste follows the nose. This is a light, easy to drink beer. Its not the most interesting Oktoberfest Ive tried, but it is the most well-crafted and probably the best overall. I like it.

Very average Oktoberfest. Sweet slight thick. Malt thickness. Nice basic Octoberfest but not what you want a lot of


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the top rated Oktoberfest beers for good reason. Not overly sweet or overly bitter. Perfectly balanced. Great mouthfeel very clean and refreshing but still full bodied. Lingers on the palate. Fantastic beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyed at Brauerei Aying in München, DE during Oktoberfest, perfect time to have this! Appearance is a clearish gold with a thin frothy white head. Aroma smells good but I have a cold, which is rough, but Im getting mostly lager yeast with a touch of malt. Taste is very good, goes down with light bitterness, not too malty honestly. Great one to enjoy during my trip here!

Very nice. Biscuity and full flavor but with enough bitterness to keep it from being too sweet. Compared to the standard fare marzens that every US brewery feels compelled to make, this one is excellent.

Bottle into mug. Clear, clean burnt orange pour with a thick one finger off white head that stays fairly well. Very smooth going down, hints of caramel. For its style, it has more flavor than most. However, in the grand scheme of beer-things, that still doesnt make up for what it lacks in richness and depth. Again, however, it is also supremely drinkable and does not bore me sip after sip. Maybe most importantly, though, it makes me feel at home and welcomed and generally how I should during the Oktoberfest season.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy honey color with off white head. Aroma is malts, bread, toast. Taste is bready, very light sweetness. Very smooth. Nice creamy smooth palate. Best of the style Ive ever had hands down. Love this brewery.

Draft at the stone street tavern NYC. Taste crisp and malty with a nice bready fall flavor. Petty good for a style I generally don't like


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cL bottle. Delicious aroma, just like a bakery or something, super-malty. Fantastic palate, very very developed and benign. Taste is not perfect, but very very good and enjoyable for the style. Its hard for me to offer specific critiques, I think theyre not likely to take my advice after making this beer for god-knows-how-long. Its very, very decent.
Dark malt, and a good example of the Oktoberfest style. Honey colored, thin head and lace. Some citrus....
Dark malt dominates, pours amber with medium creamy white head. Light malt aroma with stronger malt taste. Slightly smoky palate with abrupt finish. One of the better festbiers, as expected.

Im a huge Ayinger fan, and this beer should define the style in my opinion. Toasted malt with a nice bready touch but easy to drink and ends a bit sweet. Im not huge on the October style, but it is hard to not love this beer.

A light aroma and deep amber color raised my hopes for this one. Almost no bubbles and a distinctly nutty flavor made me appreciate these Bay Area summer (autumn) nights. It was just what I needed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour from bottle. Average head with larger bubbles subsides quickly to a speckled film. Aroma is subtle bready malt, and maybe a hint of citrus from the hops. The full body and balanced profile makes for a very pleasing flavor and mouthfeel when quaffed.

Bottle. Pours a medium amber, white head okay retention, solid lacing. Nose is malty with some candied orange. Mouth is medium bodied and malty, lots of caramel (think caramel kettle corn... or the original Poppycock or Fiddle Faddle). Malt forward (did I already mention the maltiness?), some orangey notes as well. Finishes weak which is why I took off a few points, but overall an excellent Märzen. Prost, mein freunden!

Yes this beer is delicious. BUT Im not all about it like some folks. Could be the style doesnt appeal to me like it once did. Sweet malts on the aroma, bright and clean carbonation on the palate. Would be easy to drink this by the litre in an enormous stein.

Bottle on the balcony. Aroma is malty, toasty. Sweet malt up front, noble hops on the crisp finish. Very simple flavor profile, but perfectly balanced and true to style. A great authentic Oktoberfest.
Copper with large light beige head. Toast and nuts in aroma. Malt, toast and light caramel flavor, nicely dry.
Bottle->SA. Light copper with frothy white head that soon dissipates to nothing. A: grains, caramel malt, toast, grass. T: same, bittersweet. Good, not great.
Very smoothe, crisp, and delicious. Possibly the best Oktoberfest beer Ive ever had.

Bottle: amber gold. White froth that disappears quickly. Toasty malt with ripe red apple aroma. Malt and a hint of toffee. Light medium weight. Hint of sweetness and just a touch of bitterness. Very fresh and bright with dry finish. Just lacking a little depth.
Draft at yard house. Orange with white head. Wheat earth dirt and malty. Carmel notes. Sour? I don't like it
September 2010. 500 ml. bottle. Amber color with a white head. Caramel aromas with malty and floral notes. Slightly sweet but with a good balance. Outstanding seasonal brew.

Draught. Pours amber in color with a small off-white head. Lots of malty notes, some sweet garden fruityness and some more liquid bready makty notes in aroma. Really nice. Sweetish in taste with some butterscotch and faint floral and notes of bready malts lingering beneath. This is a real treat once again from Brauerei Aying. Just a bit of burnt grainy notes in the end, but despite that the nice sweet maltyness reigns here.-- bb/wpEarlier Rating: 10/5/2012 Total Score: 3.2Bottle 50 cl. Poured hazy golden in colour with a whitish head. Malts, some earth-like notes and toffee in aroma. Flavour of hay, malts and some sweetness.

Bottle- pours clear copper, thick ring of off white head. Nose is bread, German malts, candied bananas and grains. On the tongue, malts, figs, esters, grains, drying bitterness on the finish. Medium to full bodied. Real nice example of the style even if not a favorite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours amber with nice head. Aroma is light roasted malt, low pine. Taste is very crisp and tasty, nice marzen
Clear copper pour with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel malt, bread. Taste is so good I want to move to Bavaria. Clean, refreshing, caramel, bready. Nice pleasant aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2015 Golden-amber body, medium white head, spotty lacing. Warm biscuits, caramel, floral hops, traces of banana. Medium to full bodied, smooth carbonation, prolonged, lightly-sweet finish.

Ayinger Octo pours a beautifully rich golden hue. Doughy aroma filled with delightful caramel and grain notes. Sweet malt upfront with a pretty thick mouthfeel ending with a big rich finish. A great Marzen!

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2013 From bottle 9/5/13. Clear amber color. Aroma is dark caramel malt and sweet grapes. Taste is biscuit malt, caramel, grape juice, and a hint of grassy hop bitterness. Finishes with a sweet malty aftertaste. Had again, on draught at Second Annual Humbug Lager Fest at Occidental Brewing 12/14/13. Still a favorite Oktoberfest beer.

Bottle - pours clear amber with thin white head. Nose of malt and spice. Taste is primarily sweet malt. Mild yeast presence. Very smooth and easy drinking.

Pours a clear copper with a finger of pure white head that dissipates to a thin cap. Decent amount of lacing. Nose is very malty with some caramel and raisin. A slight graininess is also present. Mouth is very much the same. A lot of malt and caramel. Slightly bitter but very good.

Pours bright amber bordering on orange. Crystal clear with a head that quickly dissipates..

Smells- malty with some caramel and drk fruit

Tastes-Malty and caramel with some raisin/figs. A little bit of bitterness to balance it all out.

MF-Medium body very little carbonation.

Overalll-One of the better Oktoberfests I have had. Great flavor and goes down smooth.

500 ml bottle from Trader Joes, and give them credit that this tastes very fresh. Pumpkin orange color, big head, toasty on the nose and creamy on the tongue. Flavor is slightly toasty and even fruity. A malt bomb, maybe equal parts Vienna and Munich. Hops are just there to dry out the finish. The King of this style.

Pours a clear light amber with a white head that has good retention. Aromas of soft caramel, some dark fruit. Taste is semi-sweet, with just a touch of bitter. Finishes pretty quick with a touch of bready malts. Decent.

Rich malty aroma full of biscuit. No hops in the aroma. Amber, clear appearance. White head with good retention. The flavor is malt forward with nice bready graininess. The mouthfeel is medium and creamy with a semidry finish. Overall an excellent example of the marzen style. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The aroma combines a floral scent with a doughy mixture. It is a darker orange color with a medium bodied head. It has a sweat, floral taste with other hops. Excellent.

This is a top choice for any "Octoberfest" style beer .. Pick this up if you see it! If you like the Sam Adams version this will not disappoint. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Btl pours clear golden copper color. Thick fluffy off white head with tiny compact bubbles. Some lacing on glass. Floral hop smell with light sweet just baked bread and biscuit aromas. Tastes of moderately sweet malt, caramel and mild bittering hops. Medium to full body with a creamy smooth texture. Nice dry finish with perfect carbonation. Exceptionally balanced easy drinking lager that has extraordinary flavors and disguises the alcohol content nicely. I could drink this beer all day.

Pours gold-orange and clear with a thick white head. Smells like beer. Aroma is strong malt and baking bread. Taste is along the same lines with notes of spice or caramel. Big body and very slight taste of alcohol. The malt flavor really lingers nicely. Very, very drinkable - I could spend a day raising these in a beer hall.

1 Pt. .9 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured hazy, medium size off white head, lots of lacing on the glass. Very malty aroma and taste, very good but perhaps a bit too sweet, drinkable and quite enjoyable. Very good representation of and Oktoberfest brew.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 Wow this was great! The aroma reminds me of a sweet bread baking. It has a beautiful Amber color. It starts off with a sweet toffee/caramel candy taste. The you get that hearty bread with lots of malt. Finishes with a rich, creamy taste. It has a very nice mouthful for a marzen. Really good!
sweet malty aroma. rich, full-bodied, uber-malty, somewhat sweet flavor. dark amber color. a classic. liquid bread.

Makes for a great all-day consumption brew for the start of football season, grilling/smoking meats all day, firing up the chiminea, raking leaves, welcoming the return of the best season of the year—autumn. Very chuggable with an ABV that should keep you out of trouble with the wife and awake for the 4th quarter of the 5pm game.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Bottle from studio b Fayetteville WV. Malty with a good spice to it. Very good aroma just a little sweet. Excellent Octoberfest.

Very typical marzen-style oktoberfest, quite drinkable but nothing to make it stand out.

Bottle at zombie burger boys night..... orangidh pour with fluffy head..very smooth and easy drinking..awesone
Pours cloudy golden orange color with froth white head. Caramel, malt and spice aromas. Caramel, malt and spice flavor. Full body and malty dry finish.
This is, I think, the best Octoberfest that I have tried.  Very malty with a medium body.

Thanks, Mike and Abbie! Nicely lustrous amber pour, with a vigorous and quite fresh-looking head. Liquid bread. Mild spice and pert fruit in the nose along with the more expected chewy notes. And for a marzen, this is certainly among the more vibrant entries you could hope to find. Modest hops, a smidge of spice, leading to a well balanced brew. This is one Id actually look forward to having again, stylistic disinterest notwithstanding.
Tap at Stones, Helsinki. Originally rated 25092011. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.
Orange/gold with a fluffy white head that fades quickly but leaves nice lacing. Flavor and aroma both have tons of caramel, biscuit, and candi sugar. A touch of spice in the finish. Good.

500ml bottle (Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki, Kalakierros 2013)
Super malty aroma. Taste is even maltier, pure barley. Plenty of yeastiness too. Hazy orange, fizzy carbonation. Then gets a bit flat. Love the malts, but it feels a bit wrong in the mouth. Malt-juice.Earlier Rating: 9/26/2008 Total Score: 3.3Keg (St. Urho’s, Helsinki)
Rich orange, tiny head. Woody aroma. Nutty edge to a dry woody taste. Rich, burnt corners too. Soft palate. Smooth grainy body. Very tasty.

Kirtabier. slightly orange with a white head. Herbs . Autumn feeling. nothing special. not worth it.Earlier Rating: 11/11/2009 Total Score: 3.6tap at One Pint Pub. Damn good easy drinking and still full of flavor and well bodied. real oktoberfestbeer for taking in great volumes.

Serving: from tap at Doyles Public House.

Aroma: lightly malty.

Appearance: large, frothy, off-white, initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity.  Hazy, flat, medium-yellow body.

Taste: moderately malty, initial flavor and heavily sweet finish with average duration.

Palate: light-to-medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Overall: too sweet for me.  I wouldnt drink this again.
Caramel, fairly light. Think these are boring just like American ambers. This one is pretty good for style. Has a semi lasting body.

A - Pours a clear golden amber with ruby highlights. 3 fingers of foamy off-white head with rings of lace.

S - Doughy honey yeast with lemon & metallic notes. Funky caramel mixed in with brown sugar as well. Tangy peaches.

T - Bready malted grain blended with a musty yeast. A toasted caramel envelopes mild earthy lemon-citrus hops. Faint cinnamon spice. Aftertaste is of soft spiced apples.

M - Medium body with a smooth texture.

An Oktoberfest with great yeast character. Good all around. I wish it was cheaper.

Serving type: bottle

10-30-2010

Deep gold, clear, off-white head.  Aroma of sweet malt, a little toast, some caramel, light alcohol.  Flavor is malty-sweet with some bready and toasty notes, just enough bitterness to prevent it from being too sweet.  Easy-drinking.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Alla spina. Torbido color arancio con un pannoso strato di schiuma bianca. Sentori di agrumi, pesca, luppolo e zucchero di canna, gusto mediamente amarognolo con note fruttate e "panose". Corpo medio lieve, struttura acquosa, un po poco persistente; è profumata e piuttosto buona ma troppo poco intensa sia nellaroma che nel gusto. Da riprovare in bottiglia, chissà...

March 20, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Clear dark golden pour with big head that lasted and lacing.  Sweet malty aroma with a touch of hops.  Taste started a bit grainy, then sweet malt and finished with a dry mild bitterness. Thin to medium bodied with some carbonation.

Nice solid Oktoberfest ... Very traditional and German tasting:)...a joy to drink!

Pours slightly hazy golden color with a medium-sized head. Aroma has some stuffy fruits, earth, nuts, fruity malts, some yeast and a bit of caramel. This is just downright tasty. Very flavorful and an excellent representation of the style. Its beers like this that do Germany proud.
slight Pilsnery smell which isnt bad...small head.. good taste... not too flavorful though.. hard to pick out what the taste is
Bottle. Golden color with a large head. Milder than most in its style. I liked that it wasn't too spicy.
clear orange yellow pour with small white head.sweet malt aroma. Taste is malty and fleshy fruit. Did not impress me.
Faint aroma of sweet malt and caramel  Nice deep yellow color with frothy white head....livley carbination.  Nice hit of sweet malt in front.  Followed by caramel, and finishes nice and dry
Dark orange colour, white/yellow head. Not a special beer, Ayinger do much better ones.... quite boring.

Kaatuu kolpakkoon rennolla kädellä kaadettuna kirkkaana, punaoranssina ja parin sormen levyisella vaahdolla, joka katoaa suht nopeasti. Haju on hiivaleipäisen maltainen, ruohoinen, hieman hedelmäinen ja taustalla on ihan lievää toffeeta ja pähkinää. Maku on viljaisen maltainen, makean toffeinen, pähkinäinen ja ruohoinen. Suutuntuma on suht täyteläinen ja hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena tämä on perushyvä lager, mallasrunko on mukavan täyteläinen ja juotavuus hyvä. Suht kevyttä, mutta maistuvaa.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2015 2015  Pours a clear copper orange with an off white head that dissipates rather quickly and leaves decent lacing.  Aroma is malty and toasty with a bit of sweetness and a hint of diacetyl.  Taste is malty with a bit of sweetness, bread crust and a hint if oxidation.  Finishes dry with a grainy/husky flavor.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  

2013 Crystal clear amber with big off white head and excellent lacing.   Aroma of pears and apples.  Fruity taste with malt and some spiciness.

Smell of pears and other fruits.  Taste has slightly spicy undertone.  Perfect drinkability.

Pours a beautiful red color with a nice amount of carbonation.  Big, white head, but I did pour it fast.  Caramel for the most part on the nose, but a bit of nuttiness to it.  Not overly sweet, but the sweetness takes over because of a lack of anything else on the tongue.  Light body, and easy drinking.  If you dont eat or drink anything, you will taste this beer for a long time.  Dont think as much of the style as others personally, but Ayinger does a damn good job on this beer.

pours light copper orange, smallish head, some subtle streams. Malts on the nose. Drinks with 8/10-sweet malts, hops, caramel, finishing clean and malty bitter. Low-med complexity, medium depth, decent carry, decent drinkability. Decent balance and body.

Well, this is true to its name. It was alright, but wont be spending 3 bucks for one again. Maybe I got a bad one that sat out too long, but it tasted like candy to me, and not in a good way. Too sweet.

bread, caramel, Toffee, Honey, toast, alcohol, butterscotch, vanilla, dark orange, cloudy, minimal head, tan foam, medium - heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle as Ayinger Kirtabier. Pours a hazy dark orange amber with a small, off-white head. Aroma is a lot of honey bread. Honey and bready malts. The taste is much of the same with the bready maltiness being much stronger and turning a bit darker. Honey is present, but not as strong as in the aroma. Not very sweet which is a good thing. A lot of beers flavored with honey tend to be much too sweet. Light herbal hoppiness in the finish and aftertaste. Palate is medium and not very carbonated.
Bottle from Wegmans Sterling - I tried this one about a month ago and just remember that I liked it. Im about 15 reviews behind I think.
Nice golden brown pour with a medium white head that reduces pretty fast. Not much on the nose for me. Some sweet malt. Medium body. Clean and refreshing finish. Really like this beer.

Draught at bar. Amber color, white head. Malty taste with citrus, caramel, toast and some bitterness. Dry bitter finish. Good seasonal brew.Earlier Rating: 9/26/2012 Total Score: 3Bottle from Alko (as Kirtabier). Thick copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, dough, toast and earthy aroma. Sour finish with bread. Decent brew, yet not my favorite style.

Smells like bread. Pours with a large white head about 3 fingers and it quickly dissipated. Very clear and copper colored with slight lacing. Carmel up front with a touch of hops and finished with almost a bread flavor. Not bad at all.

500ml bottle, been trying to move through some German beers lately so I can educate myself. nice orange-amber color, good foamy head. Smells like lager, eh. Flavor is just a real lager, grain, type of event. Shit was good but nothing stellar. I could probably knock back a couple liter of this and pass out on a picnic table. Nein!

Reviewed on: 09-02-2012 03:38:58
Great beer. One of the best Octoberfests Ive had. Discovered a few years ago and have found there are very few that can match the taste of the, caramely delicious flavor and after taste.
Not much in the way of aroma or appearance. Flavor is very nutty and grainy/wheat. Highly drinkable and not too full bodied like a lot of oktoberfests...im looking at you sam adams

Aroma is malt with notes of grain. Pours a clear amber with a active, but mostly diminishing off-white head. Taste is a light sweetness. Sweet malts, grains, and bread. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, I like this Märzen. Would drink again.

Big three fingers of head, copper colored body.
A nice grain and fresh bread smell. 
Good malt flavor with just enough sweetness. Smooth all the way through with almost no bitter profile.
Almost a creamy texture, soft with low carbonation and medium body.
An excellent märzen.

Aroma is caramel and aromatic malt along with a little banana bread, very good aroma for a lager.  Taste is a restrained smooth bitterness with a touch of caramel sweet malts and the delicious oktoberfest yeast flavor youd expect.  This is a really good oktoberfest.

Bottle. Clearer golden amber orange with a decent white head.  Not nearly as sweet as others in the style, some leafiness, light fruits as well in the aroma. Lightly malty, some sweetness, but dries out a little in the finish.  Medium to lighter oily body.

It pours a dark orange that is transparent with a thin white head that leaves some lacing.  The aroma is full of soft subtle spices.  The taste is full of these spices.  The beer is very well balanced and crisp.  Im typically not a huge oktoberfest fan but this is quite nice.  Smooth, drinkable, and tasty.  I can see why this is rated the top Oktoberfest in the world!

Tap @ The Forge Foco. Poured into a goblet, huh? Pours a dark, clear orange appearance with a cream colored head. Sweet fruity, creamy, straw, toffee, a touch boozy, straw aroma. Kind of metallic, somewhat dry. Straw, earthy, grassy, creamy caramel, somewhat floral hoppy,  toasty malty flavor. Not sure what is up with the high metallicity but its off putting.

Another good German Oktoberfest. Malty aroma with some sweetness. Coppery orange color with foamy head that lasted a while. Decent lacing. Thicker than average palate. Nice earthy tone to it of grains and malt. Well balanced and no hint of alcohol. Recommended if you like this style.Earlier Rating: 6/6/2012 Total Score: 3.8I enjoyed this considering the style is not one of my favorites. A murky brown with a malty odor. It had that funky malt taste that I associate with this style. However, it was not over the top or offensive. It was easy to drink, especially with the hamburger I was having. It had a thicker mouthfeel that I expected. I would have another if given the chance.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 Rec?d as a good Octoberfest. It?s what I had in mind--a drinkable lager with a slightly nutty caramel malt flavor. Delicious. (Virtually indistinguishable from Paulaner?s Marzen.)

Fantastic fest beer, clear copper with a soapy white head. Aroma is white bread dough, cut flowers and sweet caramel. Bitter floral hops, sweet caramel and malt. Great beer and this bottle has a fantastic bottle cap!
Bottle pour with copper color with heavy white head. Very low aroma of grass. Taste light sweetness.
Poured into lager glass, pours clear gold with decent head. Full flavored beer that finishes clean.
bottle. amber with two finger head. bready and sweet caramel. mild bodied and quite drinkable.
The nose is sweet with caramel, bread, and toffee aromas.  Copper with a fluffy off white head.  Sweet in the bread and caramel range.  Very very smooth with a nice sweet finish.

Bottle. Copper pour, off-white head, little retention/lace. Aroma of toffee, grassy/floral hops, caramel, toast. Taste is malty, grassy hops, toast, toffee. Palate is soft, creamy, sweet finish. Good.

Draught at Bishops Arms, V:a Hamngatan, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear amber, medium off-white head. Nice fruity and berryish aroma, some floral hops. Meidum bodied, medioum carbonation. Semi sweet, low to medium bitterness. Very good.
tap.  just a really nicely made marzen kinda brew.   dry toasted dough,  toffee, cereal.     clean.   tasty.   real nice.

Many thanks to Finn for yet another beer gift. The 500ml bottle, as Ayinger Kirtabier, pours a close to clear copper coloured body. Spotty lacing from a decent off-white head that stays well. Modest aroma of dried fruits and earthy malts. Leafy hops with almond, semi-sweet malts and dried fruits in the flavour character promoting a taste of bittersweet marmalade. Lingering and smooth mid-dry, bitter end. Medium bodied. Fits the season. And, as always, a pleasure to drink an Ayinger beer (Tromsø, 18.10.2012).

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Slightly hazy copper color. Sweet bready and toasty malt aroma with nuts and toffee. Sweet malty taste with toffee, toasted bread, honey, some herbal notes and low bitterness. Fruitininess comes when sediment is added. Medium body. Well made, at first this felt somewhat unexciting but sediment nicely adds richness and complexity. Goes well with pizza. Earlier Rating: 9/17/2007 Total Score: 3.7Draught at Old Bricks Inn, Jyväskylä. Copper to amber color with creamy head. Sweetish, toasty and toffeish aroma. Very rich malty flavor with toasty, nutty and caramelly notes. Mild bitterness, just enough for a balance. Very good maltiness, good beer with various foods.
Citrus, flowers, and grassy hops in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet with nut and caramel.  Some grassy hop bitterness in the finish.  Very smooth, well balanced, and easy to drink.
Direi il classicone marzen---teutonico, che bevuto ad ettolitri in compagnia è gradevole, ma poi...

500ml bottle. Pours a crystal clear golden amber wit a med to large lasting fluffy white. Aroma and taste of sweet toasted barley and grains, a bit of caramel malt,  some light fruity notes. A medium bodied, crisp and refreshing on the palate, with good carbonation. The finish is sweet toasted barley and grains, fruity, light bitterness, some yeast notes. This is an all nicely balanced, crisp and refreshing Oktoberfest. Very nice.
Pours a golden brown color with a nice white head.  Aroma of light spice, malt.  Light bodied, sweet excellent

This is THE marzen/Oktoberfest.  There is no getting around this, there is no better example out there.  I have a soft place in my heart for this style, although none really blow me away besides this one...

The commercial description gets the general idea to you nicely, otherwise: white head that dissipates quickly, floral notes, sweet taste. Overall a really good oktoberfestbier, one of the better ones Ive tried.
Green apple amongst a yeasty aroma. Same with taste with wonderful bubbly feel and balanced bittersweet finish. Wonderful beer!

Bitter smell. Dark orange colour, yellowish head. Sweet. Flat carbon. Syrupy, oily. Earlier Rating: 7/22/2011 Total Score: 2(This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

Aroma: Nice malty rich and a floral note of hops

Appearance: light yellow with tinges of amber and a  tan head

Taste: Very malty Märzen but still quite balanced and impeccably smooth 

Palate: Thick and creamy

Overall: Perhaps the most drinkable Märzen i have ever had a fantastic brew

Bottle from Alko, Keminmaa. Hazy dark amber colour, totally dissapearing head. Sweet malty aroma with some caramel. Taste is sweetish also, quite malty, ending is nice and dry. Simple but good: Ayinger never fails.

16.9 oz bottle pours amber with a white head.  Aroma of malts and a little yeast.  Taste is real nice malt.

500 ml bottle. Hazy reddish amber colout, medium off-white head. Malty, slightly earthy aroma with notes of yeast and grassy hops. The flavour is bready-malty, with yeasty and fruity notes, and a moderately bitter, grassy-hoppy finish. Medium-bodied, smoothly carbonated.
Nice and refreshing - high "drinkability".  Think I prefer Spaten and Paulaner marzens by a thin margin.... but I already finished the ones I had saved up before I could rate them here.

500ml bottle pours a clear gold/amber with large white head but little lacing.  Smells grainy and yeasty.  Aroma is malty with lots of bread, some grass, some honey.  Taste is sweet without much hops presence, but with a clean finish.  Body is medium with average carbonation.  This is very decent for what is admittedly not a favorite style of mine.
Bottle. Coppery and clear. Thin head. Yeasty, grassy, slight honey sweetness. Nice lager with a bit more heft.

Fest off , great label and cool cap. Amber hue., low carbonation light amber color like yuengling, easy drink ability, light Carmel taste, Munich malt, clean, low hops, but balanced. I would have a few more of these. Drinkable for the category..delicious
In pint glass poured from bottle . Nice caramel color. Great malt flavor. Very smooth  and drinkable. Limited hop presence.
Pours a a nice deep golden/brown. On tap at JL Beers in Fargo. Very malty and a bit sweet. Nice on its own or with a hearty meal.
Dark orange colour. Sweet and malty with a nice lively palate. A quality marzen.
This is what I want in an Oktoberfest, lacks the bitter/drying hops(that similar hop profile of a pilsner) I find in most

(bottle) pours a hazy copper-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of strawberries and bread crusts, with notes of light cherries, pale malts, yeast and herbal hops. flavour is almost like a dubbel, with notes of marshmallow, light bubble gum, bread dough and strawberries, slightly sweet, with a subtle nutty finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation. Earlier Rating: 11/9/2009 Total Score: 3.1(bottle) pours a very hazy amber colour with massive floaties and a frothy beige head. aroma of grainy malts and caramel, with a light fruity touch. flavour is the same, with a pronounced herbal hoppy light bitter finish. medium body and carbonation.
Draft. Clear golden amber color. Aroma of caramel and hay. Taste is similar.

From a 500ml bottle into a pint glass. Pours a light clear brown. Very little lacing but a few inches of head that quickly disappeared. Mild bready aroma. Crisp but still slightly oily mouth. Taste was brown sugar, OH, cake, and the usual bock/octoberfest taste. Meh. Very underwhelming and I'm not a big fan of the style.

Tried this on tap at The Hay Merchant in Houston, TX. Sweet floral aroma balanced with hops, not as tasty as some other oktoberfest marzens that I have had.

Pretty good stuff.  Reminds me of a lot of other German beers in this style.  Pours a clear golden color with very lively carbonation and fluffy head.  Head dissipates quickly.  Aroma is bready malts.  Very smooth / light, yet has a medium body.  Very short dry finish.

Pours a clear dark golden with a strong 4 finger head - maybe a too-aggressive pour. Light, malty nose - not too strong an aroma. Malty palate with some hop bitterness to balance. This is a well-balanced beer. A bit of a watery finish compared to other marzens I have tasted. Light carbonation, maybe because of the aggressive pour. Some very subtle caramel notes - this is a nuanced beer. Either that or I just tell myself I like it because everyone else seems to rate it highly.
On tap.  Comes clear amber with a decent biege head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, and grass.  Taste is caramel malt, bread, grass, and hops.  Not too sweet.  Darn near perfect marzen.

Pours a copper-orange color with a thick foamy head. Aroma is light and bready. Flavor is solidly beer-like. Nothing special here, but I guess thats what makes it good. Tremendously drinkable. Nothing heavy. Something I could drink about 4 liters of.

Pint at Tylers Apex. Good.aroma, sweet. Malty. Fruity, apple, caramel. Clean brownish orange color, small head that faded quick, no lace. Sweet flavor. Light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, bitter finish. Solid marzen. Pleasantly drinkable. Nothing jaw dropping. Just a good drinking beer. Nice Fruity aroma..
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Pours reddish orange with a frothy head that dissipates gradually. Smells of caramel, leaves and hay. Very light flavor with medium bitterness.

16 oz. bottle. It pours a very clear golden amber color with a nice lasting off white head. The aroma has some nice toasty malts with some notes of berries and noble hops. The flavor is outstanding with lots of malt complexity, noble hoppiness and a subtle sweetness of light berries and caramel topped with a crisp lager finish. Very enjoyable, especially this time of year. Oh yeah... give me more of these in the fall rather than the myriad of mediocre pumpkin ales.

Amber and somewhat hazy beer with lacy head. Fresh, bready maltiness, yeast and a good pinch of herbal hops. Round, bready malts, slightly honeyish. Dryish finish with yeast and mellow bitterness. Medium body, soft texture, slightly oily.Earlier Rating: 10/13/2011 Total Score: 3.8Draught. Clear, darkish golden colour, thin creamy head. Lovely, deep malt aroma has creamy toffee notes and, sweet breadiness and some grains. Delicate frutiness, dates and dried apricots. Light herbal hoppiness and noticable bitterness for the style make it well balanced. Very smooth texture, almost full body and very good drinkability. A high-class märzen!

On tap at Ayingers Speis und Trank in Munich.Pours rusty Amber with a huge off-white head.Aroma of spice,butterscotch and caramel malt,with notes of honey,toast,herbs,spice,dough,raisin,,nutty and caramel..

Flaske 0,5l fra Alko Muonio merket Kirtabier. Drukket hjemme 28 Sep 12. Mørk gyldenbrun. Litt skum som raskt flater ut. God søt karamellaroma. Antydning til litt frukt. Smaken brukbart fyldig. Innholdsrik. Litt krydder. Undertone av frukt. Plommer. Blir etterhvert litt syrlig. Godt øl som bringer fram minner fra en av mine ølhøydepunkter: Sommerkveld i bryggerihagen blant gode venner, godt øl og god mat.

I just picked up 60 bottles- this is truly a great Seasonal and is the best Oktoberfest I have ever had plus it seems very consistent from year to year. The refrigerator is now stocked and I will be popping the top on one of these bottles this evening!

This has a nice Autumn in a Bottle feel all around. A clear color of dying orange-reddish leaves. An aroma and taste that has slight apple and ripe grape sweetness with a freshly baked bread malt base. I picked up just a hint of hop spice/bitterness towards the end, but nothing that would slow down the chugging. An admirable restraint is shown on sweetness which tends to be an area where fall brews from states tend to go overboard. With a clean and light body, this beer is clearly meant to be enjoyed in pairs, triplets, or gaggles. A true celebration type beer. For good times sessions with friends.

Nice amber color with little head. Very sweet aroma. Delicate floral taste. Could use a little more carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Trion. Sweet corn syrup aroma. Amber with a small beige head, nice lacing.  Sweet vegetal malt flavor with a light grassy finish. Light body, flat carbonation.  Seriously dont understand the high ratings on this one.

So here is the best oktoberfest beer available. Classic dark orange clear pour. Aroma of caramel candied apple.  Nutty, grain malt and very well balanced hop-wise. Good zesty body with the right amount of kick for a proper lager. Probably the best bottom fermented non-bock beer Ive ever had.

Pours a golden orange color with a 1 cm head that lingers a bit.  Aroma is a bit boring. Mostly pale malt with a bit of grassy hops and light caramel. Really like the taste thought. Clean light caramel malt gives it a fair sweetness. Full body and slightly sticky mouthfeel is perfect for the style. Smooth crisp finish. My favorite Oktoberfest beer I've had.

Bottle. Amber color with medium-sized white head. Malty aroma with notes of yeast, some fruitiness and bread. Flavor is sweet malt, fruits and bread. Medium-bodied, slightly bitter finish.Earlier Rating: 10/5/2008 Total Score: 3.6Draught. Copper colour with a nice off-white head. Sweet malty aroma. Medium-bodied, sweet, malty and hoppy flavour. Well-balanced and slightly bitter finish. Very nice brew.

Bomber bottle poured a clear gold hue w a large white frothy head. Inviting aroma, caramel, toasted malt and hay. Light sweet initially then finishes crisp and lightly bitter. A slightly metallic moderately dry alcohol feel.

Location: 500 ml bottle from Buy Rite, 9/23/12


Aroma: It has a clean, malty aroma, caramel, bread, and notes of vegetables

Appearance: It pours a clear orange color with a small head and light lace on the glass

Flavor: The flavor has a clean, crisp maltiness, caramel and bready flavors similar to the nose
